page.title: 14MOFFAT-FROM THE OUTSIDE
page.content: All roads lead to Moffat! So it would seem in the height of summer when most of the accents of the UK, the languages of Europe,the Orient and the inflections of N.America and Australasia can be heard in and around the town.Why do tourists come to Moffat?Since the Victorians,who came in numbers to partake of the health giving spring waters,this little Annandale town has been a magnet for visitors.Our survey has shown that most visitors stay for only a few hours,a day at most;many remain for a few nights having discovered the attractions of a rural setting.Some return yearly to enjoy the tranquil setting.Coach parties by the hundred break their North or South journeys to take refreshment or visit the woollen mills.The Toffee Shop home of the famous Moffat Toffee attracts many.
